unnormalised: The Indian Premier League, or IPL, as the cool kids call it, is upon us again! And frankly, trying to keep up with the sheer volume of matches is like trying to explain the offside rule to your nan. Good luck with that. The schedule, released on 15/03/2024, is a beast, spanning from 22/03/2024 to 26/05/2024. I mean, seriously, who has time to watch all those games? My boss already thinks I'm working from home 3 days a week because of a "bad stomach" (wink wink).
normalised: The Indian Premier League, or I-P-L, as the cool kids call it, is upon us again! And frankly, trying to keep up with the sheer volume of matches is like trying to explain the offside rule to your nan. Good luck with that. The schedule, released on fifteenth March two thousand and twenty four, is a beast, spanning from twenty second March two thousand and twenty four to twenty sixth May two thousand and twenty four. I mean, seriously, who has time to watch all those games? My boss already thinks I'm working from home three days a week because of a "bad stomach" (wink wink).

unnormalised: The opening match is on 22/03/2024 at 8:00 PM IST. Chennai Super Kings (CSK) versus Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB). A classic! My money is on Dhoni’s CSK. Unless, of course, Kohli magically transforms into Superman. But, realistically, the chances are lower than finding a decent parking spot in Delhi on a Sunday.
normalised: The opening match is on twenty second March two thousand and twenty four at eight PM I-S-T. Chennai Super Kings (C-S-K) versus Royal Challengers Bangalore (R-C-B). A classic! My money is on Dhoni’s C-S-K. Unless, of course, Kohli magically transforms into Superman. But, realistically, the chances are lower than finding a decent parking spot in Delhi on a Sunday.

unnormalised: The afternoon matches always seem to sneak up on you, don't they? Like, you’re enjoying your Sunday lunch at 1:00 PM, then BAM! It’s 3:30 PM, and you’ve missed the first 5 overs. Talk about a time warp. And don’t even get me started on those double-header days. Trying to explain to your family why you’re glued to the TV from 2:00 PM to 11:00 PM is a recipe for disaster.
normalised: The afternoon matches always seem to sneak up on you, don't they? Like, you’re enjoying your Sunday lunch at one PM, then B-A-M! It’s three thirty PM, and you’ve missed the first five overs. Talk about a time warp. And don’t even get me started on those double-header days. Trying to explain to your family why you’re glued to the T-V from two PM to eleven PM is a recipe for disaster.

unnormalised: And the sheer number of matches! There are matches almost every single day. My sleep schedule is already crying. I will basically be living on caffeine and the hope that Mumbai Indians actually win a few games this season. Please, Rohit Sharma, I'm begging you. Give us something to cheer about! Otherwise, my neighbour Sharmaji will never let me live it down.
normalised: And the sheer number of matches! There are matches almost every single day. My sleep schedule is already crying. I will basically be living on caffeine and the hope that Mumbai Indians actually win a few games this season. Please, Rohit Sharma, I'm begging you. Give us something to cheer about! Otherwise, my neighbour Sharmaji will never let me live it down.

unnormalised: The playoffs start sometime around 21/05/2024, and the final... well, the final is on 26/05/2024. Mark your calendars, folks. And pray you still have some social life left by then. Seriously, I might have to invent a new holiday just to recover. Maybe "IPL Detox Day" should be observed on 27/05 every year.
normalised: The playoffs start sometime around twenty first May two thousand and twenty four, and the final... well, the final is on twenty sixth May two thousand and twenty four. Mark your calendars, folks. And pray you still have some social life left by then. Seriously, I might have to invent a new holiday just to recover. Maybe "I-P-L Detox Day" should be observed on twenty seventh May every year.

unnormalised: So, there you have it. The IPL schedule. A glorious, chaotic, sleep-depriving, stress-inducing, but ultimately, totally addictive rollercoaster. Buckle up, folks! It’s going to be a wild ride. Just don’t tell my boss I said that, ok? He still thinks I have that stomach thing.
normalised: So, there you have it. The I-P-L schedule. A glorious, chaotic, sleep-depriving, stress-inducing, but ultimately, totally addictive rollercoaster. Buckle up, folks! It’s going to be a wild ride. Just don’t tell my boss I said that, ok? He still thinks I have that stomach thing.
